description: So yeah, im going to have to look for an alternative, it just does not work for 7z

I'm fond of the default KDE apps that come with Kubuntu, but Ark could do with some improvements to it's user experience around plugins.

The error messages are not useful if a plugin is not installed.
A way to install plugins from within Ark would be great. Alternatively, useful error messages regarding what to install would be helpful.

There is also no way to configure the plugins currently (v23.08.5), beyond turning them on and off.

Eg. I'd like to configure it to use the official 7z binary for 7z and rar files, but I can find no way to do this.

For a KDE app, this lack of options is surprising and unfortunately makes this otherwise excellent tool of little use to me.
"No suitable plugin found. Ark does not seem to support this file type."
It does lack support for some compression types. But it supports the majority. It can even uncompress APK files. So, yeah it doesn't cover EVERYTHING, but it supports A LOT. I give it 5 stars.

description: Worked just fine for me extracting an xz file on Lubuntu.

.ZIP is the oldest, most basic, and most common compressed archive extractions and Ark seems to consistently mess it up. Extracting .ZIP archives typically ends up with it only extracting half or less of the file(s). I end up using unzip commands instead to reliably unzip something.

For example, I extracted ReactOS's .ISO file from a .ZIP downloaded from it's website. Despite ARK seeing that it is around 270MB in size, it only extracted 48MB. unzip gave me the full 270MB .ISO file.

If an Archive tool can't extract .ZIP files right, it's basically useless beyond being able to preview it's file strucure.
it has performance issues compared to file-roller, for example, ark gets too busy viewing filenames in a huge archive file, file-roller just quickly shows it up normally.
Ark looks like a good piece of software but unfortunately it's only extracting the filename and no file data.
summary: Looks good but fails to extract

Best Alternative is PeaZip.

This is the most simple, powerful and reliable archive manager I've ever used. It integrates very well with the KDE ecosystem and will do most of what the tar and other archive commands do in a nice, simple interface.

Like with all Linux archive utilities, you have to ensure you have installed support for that archive format on your system. This is why people are complaining about formats like .rar, .p7, and .7z not working. With the proper libraries installed, this program will decompress nearly anything, including Word docs if you want! To discover the package names on your distro for the formats you want, check the optional dependecies part of the package description.

For instance, on Manjaro I get the following using `pacman -Si ark`:
...
Optional Deps  : p7zip: 7Z format support
         unrar: RAR decompression support
         unarchiver: RAR format support
         lzop: LZO format support
         lrzip: LRZ format support
         arj: ARJ format support
...

The only reason I give it four stars is that it's pretty obvious that it hasn't been maintained meaningfully since the KDE 4 days. If it was given a KHamburgerMenu and a few other UI modernizations for the sake of coherency, I wouldn't hesitate to give it 5 stars. (To be clear, I don't think it's ugly like the people trying to use it on Gtk desktops without Qt theme support, I just wish it was more coherent with the modern KDE design language.)
Jamais rencontré aucun problème avec, sur KDE
Throws up an error when trying to extract from a RAR file, other programs work.
Does what it's needed.

Optional Deps : 
	p7zip : 7Z and Zip format support
	unrar : RAR decompression support
	unarchiver : RAR and LHA format support
	lzop : LZO format support
	lrzip : LRZ format support
	arj : ARJ format support
	libzip : Zip format support
	unzip : Legacy Zip format support
	libarchive : Tar, DEB, RPM, ISO, AppImage, XAR and CAB format support
summary: Stupid Noobs Don't Know How To Install Optional Dependecies

summary: An archive software that cannot handle non-Unicode character

description: linux常见的格式都有很好的支持，希望可以把zip等也增加支持

由于中文windows系统压缩zip文件包，内部文件名不是utf-8，而是gbk或gb18030之类。而这个是zip格式的缺陷，无文件编码声明。一般通过禁用ark插件里面的libzip和info-zip。然后更新7zip的16.02版本为新一点的17.04版本就解决了。p7zip的17.04可以看这里https://github.com/jinfeihan57/p7zip/releases/tag/v17.04
summary: 压缩包内部文件名乱码，不关ark的事哦。
